image.altText: Ligurian bees on Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

title.children: Scramble to protect world's oldest bee colony from parasitic killer

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: The SA government has never formally requested that the Commonwealth declare the algal bloom a "national disaster", a senior bureaucrat has told a parliamentary inquiry — despite a state minister "advocating" for such a response three months ago.

title.children: Algal 'disaster' request never formally made, bloom chief tells inquiry

image.altText: A man stares into the lens

props.synopsis: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.

title.children: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares

image.altText: A plane on the runway with people standing around

props.synopsis: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.

title.children: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport

image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A South Australian government aged care home, which looks after 23 people with dementia or complex disabilities, inappropriately used lap belts and other mechanical restraints to stop falls and control residents' behaviour, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'It's a human rights tragedy': Aged care facility inappropriately restrained residents

image.altText: Shaun de Bruyn stands in a grassed area wearing a white shirt and navy suit

props.synopsis: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

title.children: Tourism operators facing 'dire straits' without more algal bloom relief

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

title.children: High Court endorses use of encrypted phone app to monitor crime figures

image.altText: A couple of people riding waves on surfboards.

props.synopsis: A surfer who was twice bitten by a shark that was reportedly chasing a seal in waters off Kangaroo Island, is recovering well with a coffee, according to his boss.

title.children: Surfer bitten twice by shark, recovering well with 'flat white'

image.altText: A headshot of Taylor Swift with jewels and feathers surrounding her head

props.synopsis: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

title.children: Taylor Swift shines in Australian-designed dress in lead single

image.altText: Bella Kolinac stands with her bike helmet on on an outback road.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship — Women in Kona, Hawaii.

title.children: Outback athlete shares journey to ironman world championship

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: The Education Standards Board has closed Edge Early Learning Centre at Plympton for 90 days following an investigation into reports of "inadequate supervision" of children.

title.children: SA childcare centre 'unsuitable to open' amid supervision concerns

image.altText: A bunch of healthy looking tomatoes on a vine.

props.synopsis: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

title.children: Relief for fruit producers as SA declared free from brown rugose virus

image.altText: Flames at the blast furnace at Whyalla's steelworks.

props.synopsis: A future made in Australia? Not if gas prices keep rising, major manufacturers warn as they call for urgent action to secure affordable supply.

title.children: BlueScope Steel chief issues dire warning for manufacturing

image.altText: John Noh speaks into a microphone at a wood desk.

props.synopsis: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: Trump's Pentagon nominee flags possible 'commonsense' AUKUS changes

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say they have conducted a "significant" aerial search of a property in South Australia's mid-north, where a four-year-old boy went missing 10 days ago.

title.children: Results of drone searches for 4yo Gus on SA property 'being analysed'

image.altText: A male police officer looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: South Australia's corruption watchdog has cleared Police Commissioner Grant Stevens of a discipline breach for accidentally discharging his firearm during a house raid in the early 1990s.

title.children: SA Police Commissioner cleared over 1990s firearm incident

image.altText: A vast waterway from above

props.synopsis: The floodwaters which have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

title.children: Floodwaters 'transform whole desert' as Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre reaches peak

image.altText: A white sign with two logos and writing on it with a road, a blue sky and bushland behind it.

props.synopsis: The corporation has been fined $2,000 for failing to lodge reports to the Office of the Registrar of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Corporations.

title.children: Indigenous-run corporation convicted, fined for failing to lodge reports

image.altText: A smaller Kangaroo stands in front of a larger kangaroo in high grass.

props.synopsis: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

title.children: Kangaroos add pressure on drought-hit farmers by eating scarce feed

image.altText: SUV with bullet holes

props.synopsis: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a day care centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

title.children: 'Collateral damage' avoided as NSW Police foil alleged hit near day care

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: The tails of Qantas planes showing the flying kangaroo pass each other at Sydney Airport.

props.synopsis: Qantas says it is continuing to support customers as a hacking group threatens to release personal data from around 40 companies to the dark web.

title.children: Qantas 'supporting' customers after latest stolen data threat

image.altText: Gold bullion stacking up.

props.synopsis: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

title.children: Gold prices surge as investors watch 'extraordinary global scenario'

image.altText: A yellow Australian rules ball sitting on the grass.

props.synopsis: A Perth football club faces deregistration and has been expelled from their club rooms after a player reportedly attended a post-season party dressed as Stephen Hawking, allegedly with explicit images attached.

title.children: Explicit 'Silly Sunday' Stephen Hawking stunt sees football club facing expulsion

image.altText: A blue Southwest plane parked on tarmac, with a air traffic  tower behind it.

props.synopsis: The US government shutdown is entering its second week and the impacts are starting to play out, with thousands of flights disrupted across the country.

title.children: Why the government shutdown is causing chaos at US airports

image.altText: Two bald men in suits in a side-by-side call-in panel on a television news segment.

props.synopsis: A Trump administration official faces criticism after allegedly claiming US President Donald Trump has "plenary authority" while on a live interview with CNN.

title.children: Trump aide freezes on live TV after controversial claim about president

image.altText: The Victoria Police insignia on the sleeve of an officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a digital forensics officer and are investigating whether his work compromised hundreds of cases over nearly a decade including sexual offence and child abuse cases.

title.children: Police alerting accused offenders and lawyers as hundreds of cases re-examined

image.altText: A woman in a dark hijab smiles as she holds a toddler in her arms on a beach.

props.synopsis: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.

title.children: 'He doesn't feel like a normal child': War's toll on Gaza's babies

image.altText: A man smiles while speaking in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: An appeal against a $2.85 million compensation payout to a man who suffered child sexual abuse while in state care should be abandoned, a prominent Perth lawyer and the state opposition says.

title.children: Abuse survivor 'mortified' by state's challenge of $2.85m compensation payout

image.altText: Shannon Cox with a football in his hand.

props.synopsis: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox, who had meth is his system when his car smashed into a hatchback, killing two elderly women, is jailed for manslaughter.

title.children: Ex-AFL player Shannon Cox jailed for killing women in meth-fuelled crash

image.altText: A smart watch on a man's wrist with the number 56 on it.

props.synopsis: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

title.children: Strava has accused Garmin of copying it in a lawsuit. Here's what we know

image.altText: Andreas Slavkos at his graduation.

props.synopsis: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.

title.children: Careers in limbo after graduates discover university courses were never accredited

image.altText: Aerial view of humpback whales in tight formation.

props.synopsis: A drone photographer captures vision of a tightly packed pod of 11 humpback whales heading south in a race to mate off the NSW mid-north coast.

title.children: Humpback whales spotted in large, speedy pod during 'mating pursuit'

image.altText: A long line of people hiking on a snow-covered mountain.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

title.children: More than 500 hikers reportedly rescued from Mount Everest

image.altText: Mark Latham wearing a suit speaking to media on the street outside court.

props.synopsis: Independent MP Mark Latham has spoken out against former partner Nathalie Matthews during an ongoing legal battle, on the same day she pleaded not guilty to intimate image charges in a separate matter.

title.children: Mark Latham's outburst against ex-partner outside court
